revisions.revision: Named phmo parts. such as Forge 2.0

float32.name: Low Frequency Deactivation Scale
float32.tooltip: 0 is default (1). LESS than 1 deactivates less aggressively. GREATER than 1 is more agressive.

float32.name: High Frequency Deactivation Scale
float32.tooltip: 0 is default (1). LESS than 1 deactivates less aggressively. GREATER than 1 is more agressive.

float32.name: Custom Shape Radius
float32.tooltip: 0 defaults to .016. This field is intentionally hidden because we should only alter this for very special situations. Lower number == lower performance

float32.name: Maximum Penetration Depth Scale
float32.tooltip: 0 is default (1). for objects that are prone to falling through the world we can reduce this number at the cost of performance

float32.name: Maximum Force
float32.tooltip: 0 defaults to k_real_max

float32.name: Minimum Force
float32.tooltip: 0 defaults to maximum force. In general you should leave this alone unless working on ragdolls or something like them

float32.name: Damping
float32.tooltip: 0 means default daming of 1.0f

float32.name: Minimum Force
float32.tooltip: 0 defaults to maximum force. In general you should leave this alone unless working on ragdolls or something like them

float32.name: Tau
float32.tooltip: from 0-1. relative stiffness

float32.name: Damping
float32.tooltip: from 0-1

float32.name: Proportion Recover Velocity
float32.tooltip: fraction of recover velocity used. 0 defaults to 1

float32.name: Constant Recover Velocity
float32.tooltip: velocity used to recover when errors happen. in degrees per second

stringid.name: Marker Name
stringid.tooltip: you don't need this if you're just generating effects. If empty it defaults to the up of the object

stringid.name: Alignment Marker Name
stringid.tooltip: you don't need this if you're just generating effects. If empty it defaults to "marker name"

float32.name: Hooke's Law E
float32.tooltip: 0 if you don't want this to behave like spring. 1 is a good starting point if you do.

float32.name: Linear Dead Radius
float32.tooltip: radius from linear motion origin in which acceleration is dead.

float32.name: Center Acceleration
float32.tooltip: motion towards marker position

float32.name: Center Maximum Velocity
float32.tooltip: motion towards marker position

float32.name: Axis Acceleration
float32.tooltip: motion towards marker axis, such that object is on the axis

float32.name: Axis Maximum Velocity
float32.tooltip: motion towards marker axis, such that object is on the axis

float32.name: Direction Acceleration
float32.tooltip: motion along marker direction

float32.name: Direction Maximum Velocity
float32.tooltip: motion along marker direction

float32.name: Orbit Acceleration
float32.tooltip: negative values spin the opposite direction from positive ones

float32.name: Alignment Hooke's Law E
float32.tooltip: 0 if you don't want this to behave like spring. 1 is a good starting point if you do.

float32.name: Alignment Acceleration
float32.tooltip: align objects in the phantom with the marker

float32.name: Alignment Maximum Velocity
float32.tooltip: align objects in the phantom with the marker

bit.name: Is Rigid
bit.tooltip: this constraint makes the edge rigid until it is loosened by damage

bit.name: Disable Effects
bit.tooltip: this constraint will not generate impact effects

bit.name: Not Created Automatically
bit.tooltip: this flag is used for special systems that need to create constraints dynamically

float32.name: Friction
float32.tooltip: 0 is the default (takes what it was set in max) anything else overrides that value

stringid.name: Node A Global Material Name
stringid.tooltip: if you don't fill this out we will pluck the material from the first primitive, of the first rigid body attached to node a

stringid.name: Node B Global Material Name
stringid.tooltip: if you don't fill this out we will pluck the material from the first primitive, of the first rigid body attached to node b, if node b is none we use whatever material a has

tagblock.name: Rigid Bodies

bit.name: Disable Effects
bit.tooltip: this rigid body will not generate impact effects unless it hits another dynamic rigid body that does

bit.name: Does Not Interact With Environment
bit.tooltip: set this flag if this rigid bodies won't touch the environment, this allows us to open up some optimizations

bit.name: Best Early Mover Body
bit.tooltip: if you have either of the early mover flags set in the object definitoin this body will be choosen as the one to make every thing local to, otherwise I pick

bit.name: Has No Phantom Power Version
bit.tooltip: don't check this flag without talking to eamon

bit.name: Infinite Intertia Tensor
bit.tooltip: rigid body will never have angular velocity

bit.name: Can Use MOPPs
bit.tooltip: this flag was invented for the behemoth and is dangerous to use anywhere else

int16.name: No Phantom Power Alternative Rigid Body Index

float32.name: Inertia Tensor Scale
float32.tooltip: 0.0 defaults to 1.0

float32.name: Linear Damping
float32.tooltip: this goes from 0-10 (10 is really, really high)

float32.name: Angular Damping
float32.tooltip: this goes from 0-10 (10 is really, really high)

tagblock.comment: if any of these fields are non-zero, this overrides the bounding box used for water physics

float32.name: Water Physics X0
float32.tooltip: x0 value of the water physics Axis-Aligned Bounding Box

float32.name: Water Physics X1
float32.tooltip: x1 value of the water physics Axis-Aligned Bounding Box

float32.name: Water Physics Y0
float32.tooltip: y0 value of the water physics Axis-Aligned Bounding Box

float32.name: Water Physics Y1
float32.tooltip: y1 value of the water physics Axis-Aligned Bounding Box

float32.name: Water Physics Z0
float32.tooltip: z0 value of the water physics Axis-Aligned Bounding Box

float32.name: Water Physics Z1
float32.tooltip: z1 value of the water physics Axis-Aligned Bounding Box

enum16.name: Shape Type
enum16.tooltip: this and the shape index below becomes a pointer to the given shape in memory at runtime. don't poke me

float32.name: Bounding Sphere Pad
float32.tooltip: the bounding sphere for this rigid body will be outset by this much

enum8.name: Proxy Collision Group
enum8.tooltip: does not affect anything, change the groups in the individual shapes instead.

enum8.name: Collision Group
enum8.tooltip: This value overrides the default group, model, and rigid body.

enum8.name: Collision Group
enum8.tooltip: This value overrides the default group, model, and rigid body.

uint64.name: Runtime Code Pointer
uint64.tooltip: becomes a pointer in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint64.name: User Data
uint64.tooltip: The offset from the start of the block to the start of this shape (index * block element size). This becomes a pointer to this shape in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint64.name: Runtime Code Pointer
uint64.tooltip: becomes a pointer in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint64.name: User Data
uint64.tooltip: The offset from the start of the block to the start of this shape (index * block element size). This becomes a pointer to this shape in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint64.tooltip: becomes a pointer in memory at runtime. don't poke me

float32.name: w Axis-Aligned Bounding Box Half Extents

uint64.name: Runtime Four Vectors Pointer
uint64.tooltip: becomes a pointer to where the four vectors for this list start in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint64.name: Runtime Plane Equations Pointer
uint64.tooltip: becomes a pointer to where the plane equations for this list start in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint64.tooltip: becomes a pointer in memory at runtime. don't poke me
